title: Nadine Gordimer - Novels, Short Stories & Essays (24 books)
description:
NADINE GORDIMER (1923-2014) was a South African writer, political activist and recipient of the 1991 Nobel Prize in Literature.  The Swedish Academy noted that "her magnificent epic writing has, in the words of Alfred Nobel, been of very great benefit to humanity."  Apart from the Nobel Prize, she was the recipient of prestigious literary awards in South Africa, Europe, and the U.S., including a number of annual CNA Literary Awards in South Africa, the W.H. Smith Literary Award, the James Tait Black Memorial Prize, the Booker Prize and the Grand Aigle d'Or.  In 2007 Gordimer was awarded the French Legion of Honour.

Her work has been described as "history from the inside", dealing with moral and racial issues, particularly the devastating impact of apartheid on the lives of all South Africans.  Through her novels, short stories, and essays, Gordimer revealed the prejudices and ideologies, the tensions and stresses of life in a racially divided society and the corrupting and corrosive effects of the apartheid system.
